speaker: JIM PARKER
line: I'm not a killer... and I never meant to hurt no one. But I'm tired of my cattle being butchered a hundred miles from the slaughterhouse. That's the fourth one this month alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then who or what do you think was responsible?

speaker: JIM PARKER
line: Look, mister. That cow looked like a piece of paper that had gone through a shredder. I don't know of no animal that could have done that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then are you saying that a person or persons was responsible for this?

speaker: DAVID GATES
line: I want to remind you that Mr. Parker is free on bond pending trial. He's willfully speaking with you solely in regards to this incident and not about any other pending litigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So we can't talk about Mr. Parkers federal court case against the Trego indian reservation?

speaker: DAVID GATES
line: That's exactly what I mean.

speaker: JIM PARKER
line: Now wait just a damned second...

speaker: DAVID GATES
line: Jim, don't say a word.

speaker: JIM PARKER
line: No, this ain't the time for that lawyer crap. I want to get this out in the open. You people think I went and killed me an Indian just because we're having an argument about where my land ends and their land begins.

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: We want to settle that peacefully, in court.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Joseph Goodensnake is dead with a wound from your shotgun to indicate otherwise.

speaker: JIM PARKER
line: All I'm saying, it was no kind of animal that I know of. But it damn well didn't seem human neither, that night. Take a look at my boy's scars. It was dark, we heard a growl and we went out there to protect the cattle. I could have swore I saw... red eyes and fangs. I thought my boy Lyle was... look, nobody - nobody - was more shocked and upset than I was to find out it was that young Indian boy, but if he was the one that was killing our cattle, I'm very, very sorry that we had to find out about it that way, but as far as I'm concerned, that's the end of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can we see the corral?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: I'll take you out there.

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: Agent Scully? I suppose if I were hearing our side of the story, it might not hold up too well. Parts I don't understand myself - things my father could never try to explain to a stranger.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kinds of things?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: For the last few months, whenever we'd go outside at night and check on the cattle - never saw anything out of the ordinary. Not a mountain lion, not a coyote, not even any Tregos, Agent Scully. But I could feel it. Something not human... out there... watching me. The air was more still, the night animals more quiet. It was like nature herself was terrified. It gave me the creeps.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The creeps?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: Yeah, the creeps. Don't you ever get the creeps?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victim was shot there, about three meters from where Parker fired. There's no way he could have mistaken a person for an animal. It's open-and-shut, Mulder. You know, I'm surprised you volunteered for this assignment. Any Bureau agent could have investigated this reservation homicide. Why are you interested?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there seems to be nothing unexplainable about this case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nope. Not a thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this is so odd. It's almost like a snakeskin that's been shed. I suspect that the Parkers knowingly killed Joe Goodensnake, but they hardly seem the type to skin their victim.

speaker: MULDER
line: Besides which, police and coroner's report make no mention of such an act.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we're going to have to take a look at the body ourselves.

speaker: MULDER
line: The body's been transferred to the reservation authorities. We're supposed to get in touch with, uh, um, Sheriff Charlie Tskany.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, uh, we're not from around here. We're looking for Sheriff Tskany.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anyone, uh, know Charlie Tskany?

speaker: ISH
line: Go home, FBI.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you know?

speaker: ISH
line: I could smell you a mile away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, they told me that even though my deodorant's made for a woman, it's strong enough for a man.

speaker: ISH
line: I was at Wounded Knee in 1973. What I learned fighting the FBI is you don't believe in us and we don't believe in you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to believe.

speaker: ISH
line: Why you here? What are you looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you already know what we're looking for.

speaker: ISH
line: You tell me what I know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're looking for any individuals who might be able to provide information on the homicide of Joe Goodensnake...

speaker: MULDER
line: We're looking for anything that can create human tracks in one step and animal tracks in the next.

speaker: ISH
line: Parker. He found what you're looking for. He killed what you're looking for, FBI.

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: What Parker and his kid killed was my brother... and you're all too afraid of some stupid Indian legend to do anything. I hate it.

speaker: ISH
line: Gwen!

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: And I hate suits who are always here when they need something from us, but when we need help, they're nowhere to be found.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff Tskany? I'm Agent Scully and this is Agent Mulder.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Goodensnake's body is in my office.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Bill, Tom. Let 'em through. Come on, boys, let 'em through.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who were they?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Guardians of the dead. They escort the deceased's spirits to the new world. I only let them as far as the front door. Anybody that knows me knows that I keep the ancient beliefs out there and the police work in here.

speaker: MULDER
line: The woman in the pool hall said that people were afraid of some Indian legend. What do they believe happened in the Parker case?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Look, I'm not a park ranger here to answer all your questions about Indians. Whenever I need federal help, I never get it. Since this case falls under the jurisdiction of the FBI, you're entitled to examine the body. So let's get it over with.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was the woman in the pool hall his sister?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Gwen. She and Joe are primarily responsible for fueling the boundary dispute with Parker. They felt that he had been grazing his cattle farther and farther onto the reservation. Parker probably told you it was his idea to settle in court. Joe and Gwen filed the suit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Take a look at that scar tissue.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like he'd been attacked by an animal as well.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Could Joe have been attacked also? Maybe the Parkers did see an animal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Those wounds have been healing for quite some time. The shotgun wound indicates point-blank range. The pellets entered the body in a single mass. The assailant couldn't have been more than three feet away.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're gonna need to take a look at Joe Goodensnake's dental records.

speaker: MULDER
line: See, these are the canine cuspids. They're normal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, could his records have been switched or misplaced?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, you see the second incisor here is chipped just like the ones in his mouth. These match Joe Goodensnakes'.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there are cases of calcium phosphate salts developing abnormally with age, but...

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: That could account for what Jim Parker claims to have seen. He was out that night, expecting to see a mountain lion killing his cattle. He gets rattled and the flashlight beam catches Joe, here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So Parker saw what he wanted to see, an animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lyle Parker was attacked, he has scars just like Joe. Do you have a facility where we can perform an autopsy?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if Joe's teeth are abnormal, an autopsy might reveal abnormalities in the interior of his anatomy as well.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: I can't allow that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fully qualified.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: No. I can't let you do an autopsy. The funeral is tonight.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a cremation. After that, we'll have nothing.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Tregoes believe that the recent dead are unsettled by their new condition as spirits. Any desecration of the body angers the spirit and keeps it haunting this world.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you're a law enforcement officer. You can't destroy evidence.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Don't tell me what I can't do. Native Americans believe that their law is greater and more just than that of the U.S. government. If they want Joe at rest rather than used as a piece of evidence, that's the way it's gonna be. If you want to make an issue out of it - your higher authority - go right ahead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Charlie? Do you believe that the spirit of Joe Goodensnake is in that room?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: All I know is - tomorrow, day after - you're gonna leave. But I have to stay here. I've gotta answer to these people. You can continue your investigation, but you're gonna have to do it without Joe Goodensnake's body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, since we've been here, you've acted as if you've expected to find every piece of evidence that we've come across. What aren't you telling me? Why are we here?

speaker: MULDER
line: A true piece of history, Scully. The very first X-file, initiated by J. Edgar Hoover himself in 1946. During World War II, a series of murders occurred in and around the northwest, seven here in Browning alone. Each victim was basically ripped to shreds and eaten, as if by a wild animal. However, many of the victims were found at home, as if they allowed their killer to enter. In 1946, police cornered what they believed to be such an animal in a cabin in Glacier National Park. They shot it, but when they went in to retrieve the carcass, they found only the body of Richard Watkins.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sounds like the Parker scenario.

speaker: MULDER
line: The murders stopped that year. Because the cases were unsolved and considered so bizarre, Hoover locked them away, hoping that in time people around here would forget about them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This file indicates that they started again in 1954.

speaker: MULDER
line: In '59, '64, '78 and now again in '94. But...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Here it comes.

speaker: MULDER
line: ... these animal-man related murders predate the oldest X-file by 150 years. Members of the Lewis and Clark expedition wrote of Indian men who could change their shape into that of a wolf.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what this, what this folder describes is called lycanthropy. It's a type of insanity in which an individual believes that he can turn into a wolf. I mean, no one can physically change into an animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can you just dismiss the evidence - the tracks in the mud, the shredded skin, a man with the teeth of an animal?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, even if you're right and Joe Goodensnake did somehow have the ability to transform physically into an animal, he's dead. Jim Parker shot him and in a couple of moments, his body will be burned. End of mystery.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's hope so.

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: You don't belong here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gwen...

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: You're only around to wrap up your investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just wanted to say that I'm sorry about your brother. I feel sad for anyone who loses a part of their family.

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: A part? He was my whole family. I'm it now. As a demonstration of sorrow... I'm supposed to give away all my brother's possessions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gwen, I don't know what to say. I'm...

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: It's no big deal. He had more possessions than he had friends.

speaker: MULDER
line: I read the report of your investigation into the Goodensnake homicide. It was very good, thorough, professional. But what I want to know is off the record. What do you think really happened?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Your explanation, Agent Mulder, is lying on that burial platform. Why don't you just accept that and go home?

speaker: MULDER
line: Charlie, do you believe in shape-shifting?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: This is a funeral.

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: Get out of here!

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: Please, I just want to show my respects.

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: I don't want your respects. I want your heart to grow cold. I want you to feel what I'm feeling.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: I think you better leave, Mr. Parker.

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: I wish your brother could be here. I wish that more than anything else.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By the way the body's been mutilated, I'd say he's been attacked by a large predator, or someone wanted it to look that way. Do you think this is retaliation for the death of Joe Goodensnake?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you talked to Gwen Goodensnake? She seemed pretty upset last night.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: She's gone. Nobody's seen her since the funeral. I put an APB out on her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what about Lyle Parker?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: I can't find him either.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He could be dead as well. I'll take a look around.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's not from any animal I've ever seen. Sheriff, I think it's time we had a talk. An exchange of ideas?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! Mulder, I'm taking Lyle to the hospital. He's suffering from exposure, and when he's been checked out, I'm gonna question him.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you hiding?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: I thought it was over.

speaker: MULDER
line: Over? Is that why you wouldn't allow an autopsy on Joe Goodensnake's body? You thought it would all end when he was cremated? What were you afraid we'd find?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: I can't tell you. But I'll take you to somebody who can.

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: I'm ashamed to say it after what happened after the funeral. I picked up some bourbon, and I don't remember a thing after that. Sometimes when I'm down, I go out to where me and my dad keep stray animals that wander in on the ranch. I just watch them, you know, it keeps things in perspective. Anyway, my mom, when she was alive, was the one that started keeping those animals. I guess I go out there and think about her, too. God, I must have been really wasted to run around there naked. You must have thought I was one of those animals.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When you did go home, did you talk to your father?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: No, he'd have been mad I even went to the funeral. I, I have an, uh, image of him sitting on the front porch but... I don't remember talking to him. Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your father's dead. I'm sorry. It appears as if he's been attacked by an animal, but I suspect it may be homicide. Lyle, I lost my father recently and I know how overwhelming...

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: Was it my fault? By going to the funeral, did it anger them into killing my father?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: I can deal with death, you know, living on the ranch, being close to nature and all, you see how it all works. Things are born, things die, everything else falls in between. But if I caused it, I brought it on, I couldn't, uh, I, I...

speaker: ISH
line: I saw it once with my own eyes. It was a long time ago. It seems like a dream. I was a boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: In 1946? The Watkins case?

speaker: ISH
line: I sense you are different, FBI. You're more open to Native American belief than some Native Americans. You even have an Indian name - Fox. You should be "Running Fox", or "Sneaky Fox".

speaker: MULDER
line: Just as long as it's not "Spooky Fox". Tell me, Ish... what did you see?

speaker: ISH
line: Watkins had been attacked by an animal when he was alone in the woods. His scars healed. He was forgotten, then the murders began. The Tregoes, we realized that Watkins had been attacked by what the Algonquins called the manitou... an evil spirit capable of changing a man into a beast. To be attacked by a manitou causes the victim to become one.

speaker: MULDER
line: The healed scars on Joe Goodensnake's body.

speaker: ISH
line: A manitou overtakes a man by night, not by full moon. But when its blood lust builds to an uncontrollable level, a man changes to a sickening creature. It kills, releasing the savage energy. The man returns to his true self, unaware of what has happened. The cycle begins anew the next day. This continues until death. One night, when I was 16 years old, I was coming back from fishing at the Cut Bank Creek. I knew a shortcut behind Watkins' house. There was a groan, not animal but not human. I looked into his window. He was covered in sweat and blood. He was in a great, great pain. His arm - the skin ripped. It tore up and fell to the floor. Claws sprang from his fingernails. He turned, screaming, and he saw me. His eyes... his eyes were still human. They begged me to kill him. If I had been hunting and had my gun, I'd have done it without a second thought, but being a boy and scared to death, I ran away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shortly after, the police killed him.

speaker: ISH
line: But the manitou rose again.

speaker: MULDER
line: Eight years later. But with Watkins dead, how could there have been an attack by manitou?

speaker: ISH
line: Watkins had a son. It could be passed along blood lines.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Gwen. If Joe Goodensnake was this creature, then perhaps it didn't originate in him by the first attack but was handed down through the blood lines. This means Gwen could have it also. Gwen could have killed Parker.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gwen!

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Hey!

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: No! No!

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: You're under arrest, Gwen, for stealing Ish's car!

speaker: ISH
line: What happened, Gwen? What are you running away from?

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: I saw it. I, I saw it kill Parker.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let her up.

speaker: GWEN GOODENSNAKE
line: I went there after the funeral. I was gonna mess up the kid, and so I waited. But Parker was on the porch, and then this thing, this animal - oh my God. I've never been so scared. I ran and I hid in the woods all day. I wanted to get out... I wanted to get out of here. I wanted to get out of here. Oh, oh.

speaker: ISH
line: Bring her inside.

speaker: DR. JOSEPHS
line: Thank you. Hello, this is Dr. Josephs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, this is Agent Mulder from the FBI. I was told I could reach Agent Scully at this number.

speaker: DR. JOSEPHS
line: Oh, yes, we released Lyle Parker from the hosptial and she's taking him back to the ranch.

speaker: MULDER
line: So I can reach her there?

speaker: DR. JOSEPHS
line: Uh-huh. They just left. Agent Mulder, there's something I feel you should know. I received a blood test performed on Lyle Parker, and there's something rather unsettling.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's that?

speaker: DR. JOSEPHS
line: Traces of his father's blood type. It can only be there by ingestion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Power's out.

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: Yep. Happens to us all the time, being out here in the sticks. I'll fire up the generator.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You OK?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: I feel sick. Please, help me into the bathroom.

speaker: MULDER
line: Damn! It keeps disconnecting. The mountain must be blocking the signal. How much farther?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: About 7 miles.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lyle? Let me come in. Lyle, I want to take you back to the hospital, OK?

speaker: LYLE PARKER
line: No. I'll be all right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lyle? Lyle, answer me. Lyle, are you all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: MULDER
line: Augh!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's OK, it's me. It's me. I don't know what happened. Something jumped me downstairs and I lost my gun.

speaker: MULDER
line: I heard it come up here. Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: You all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh my God! He was in the bathroom, sick, and then the next thing I knew we were attacked by the mountain lion.

speaker: MULDER
line: It wasn't a mountain lion, Scully.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: It's still in a cage out back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Gwen? She said she'd come see us before we left.

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: She left last night. Gave away all her possessions to her friends.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just pulled up and left? Why would she do that?

speaker: SHERIFF TSKANY
line: Brother's gone, no family. Trouble with Parker is all over. Maybe she saw something that she wasn't ready to understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: ISH
line: FBI! See you in about... eight years.

speaker: MULDER
line: I hope not.
